attributes.action: Tell Ofcom to change their advise about Credit Cards for age verification
attributes.additional_details:
We've seen first hand how the OSA has severely affected numerous adults, but especially towards those who're on benefits due to a wide range of mental & physical disabilities. Credit Cards AREN'T acquirable by those who rely solely on benefits from the Government, and this must be addressed and corrected.

For example; if the T&C for a site states that a user must be 13 to use its paid services, then an account that is 5 years old should be able to purchase and view age restricted content.
attributes.background: The current advise set by ofcom for multiple platforms is to perform Age Verification via Credit Cards. This is Ableist in nature & dehumanizes disabled individuals by restricting and barring us access to content we have full legal right to.

rejection.details: We cannot accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. Ofcom are operationally independent of Government. You can contact Ofcom here: https://www.ofcom.org.uk/about-ofcom/what-we-do/contact-us
